result.execSummary:
The defendant Jay M Johnstone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 8/1/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 11 days jail, consecutive, for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine.

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jay M Johnstone

records.descr: Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Affidavit for Services Rendered filed by Atty Wolff.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jay M Johnstone in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Bryan Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  
The Defendant was sentenced as follows:

COUNT 1:

FINE: $326.00 (to pay $50.00 per month commencing 8/1/16 or serve 11 days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment of fine);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00, to be paid at $50.00 per month consecutive to payment of fine. Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 28, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Jury status hearing on June 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jay M Johnstone in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Wolff requests the Court set the matter for trial as the parties have not reached an agreement.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jay M Johnstone in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Wolff requests the Court set the matter for disposition in about 30 days.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Hearing at 04-05-2016 10:00 am
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Jay M Johnstone did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Wolff has received discovery and an offer and request the court set the matter out in about 30 days.  Attorney Wolff to advise the Court how the case will proceed at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Hearing at 02-19-2016 01:30 pm
Hearing at 02-12-2016 02:30 pm
Demand for Jury Trial filed by defendant.
Filed by defendant.
Hearing at 02-10-2016 03:00 pm
Defendant to pay: $100 per month commencing 3/1/16

Defendant Jay M Johnstone in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant advises the Court he does not have an attorney and does not qualify for representation of counsel by the public defender's office. There is a fine only offer.   The Defendant is sworn in and testifies.  The Court finds the Defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel and will appoint an attorney at the repayment rate of: $100.00  per month commencing 3/1/16.  Hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing at 01-20-2016 08:30 am
From defendant received 12/22/15 requesting adjournment to retain legal counsel.
Hearing at 01-05-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Jay M Johnstone in court.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant has not obtained an attorney but has not retained an attorney.  The Defendant to advise how case will proceed at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 11-23-2015 08:30 am
Defendant to have no contact with Kohl's store or any witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Jay M Johnstone in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  State has no offer to amend charges.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
